@coffeekraken.s-bench.shared.interface.S.name: SBenchSettingsInterface
@coffeekraken.s-bench.shared.interface.S.description: This interface represent the SBench settings.

title.description: Specify a title for your bench that will be used in the log

body.description: Specify a body for your bench that will be used in the log

@coffeekraken.s-bench.shared.SBench.name: SBench
@coffeekraken.s-bench.shared.SBench.description:
This class allows you to perform some simple benchmarking actions
like dividing a process into multiple "steps" and track the timing
between these, etc...

benchenv.name: benchEnv
benchenv.description:
This static method allows you to get the current bench environment
the process is running in. The bench environment

filter.name: filter
filter.description:
This method allows you to activate a list of bench id(s).
You can specify "" for wildcard

filtered.name: filtered
filtered.description: This method allows you to get back the list of activated bench(s)

isbenchactive.name: isBenchActive
isbenchactive.description: This method allows you to check if a particular bench id is active

getbenchinstancebyid.name: getBenchInstanceById
getbenchinstancebyid.description:
This static method allows you to get back a current SBench instance by it's id,
or get back a new instance that you can use directly

start.name: start
start.description: This method allows you to start a new bench "session"

step.name: step
step.description:
This method allows you to declare a new step in your bench.
A step is simple a point in your code like "after compilation", etc.
It will keep track of each steps and display the time it has taken
from the last step.

end.name: end
end.description: This method allows you to end a bencvh "session"

log.name: log
log.description: This method allows you to log the summary if this bench is active

isactive.name: isActive
isactive.description: This method allows you to check if the current bench is active or not.

tostring.name: toString
tostring.description: This method allows you to print the bench in string format

@coffeekraken.s-color.shared.interface.S.name: SColorApplyParamsInterface
@coffeekraken.s-color.shared.interface.S.description: This class represent the interface that describe parameters of the SSvelteCompiler

desaturate.description: Allows you to desaturate the color using a percentage

saturate.description: Allows you to saturate the color using a percentage

greyscale.description: Allows you to get back the grayscale version of your color

spin.description: Spin the hue on the passed value (max 360)

transparentize.description: The amount of transparency to apply between 0-100|0-1

alpha.description: The new alpha value to apply between 0-100|0-1

opacity.description: The new alpha value to apply between 0-100|0-1

opacify.description: The amount of transparence to remove between 0-100|0-1

darken.description: The amount of darkness (of the nightmare of the shadow) to apply between 0-100

lighten.description: The amount of lightness (of the sky of the angels) to apply between 0-100

invert.description: Specify if you want to invert the color to keep a good contrast ratio with a background for example

@coffeekraken.s-color.shared.interface.S.name: SColorSettingsInterface
@coffeekraken.s-color.shared.interface.S.description: This interface represent the settings of an SColor instance.

returnNewInstance.description: Specify if the methods returns by default a new SColor instance or the same

defaultFormat.description: Specify the default format of the color

@coffeekraken.s-conductor.js.interface.S.name: SConductorSettingsInterface
@coffeekraken.s-conductor.js.interface.S.description: This interface represent the SConductor settings.

idleTimeout.description: Specify after how many milliseconds of inactity the SConductor has to be considered as idle

logTimeout.description: Specify after how many milliseconds of inactity the SConductor has to log the small analysis

log.description: Specify if you want to log the small analysis when the SConductor is idle

@coffeekraken.s-glob.node.interface.SGlo.name: SGlobSettingsInterface
@coffeekraken.s-glob.node.interface.SGlo.description: This interface represent the SGlob settings.

cwd.description: Specify the working directory to run the command in.

symlinks.description: Specify if you want to follow symlinks or not

nodir.description: Specify if you want to ignore directories or not

contentRegExp.description: Specify a regex to use on the file content to filter resolved files

SFile.description: Specify if you want back some SFile instances or simple string path

exclude.description: Specify some paths or patterns you want to exclude from your resolve process

defaultExcludes.description: Specfy if you want to use the default excludes globs setted under the config.storage.exclude configuration

@coffeekraken.s-glob.node.SGlob.name: SGlob
@coffeekraken.s-glob.node.SGlob.description:
This class represent a glob pattern and can be used to resolve some globs and get back
an array of SFile instances or to extract some part of the pattern, etc...

isglob.name: isGlob
isglob.description: Alias to the ```isGlob``` function available in sugar under "shared.is.isGlob" namespace

resolve.name: resolve
resolve.description: Alias to the ```resolveGlob``` function available in sugar under "node.glob.resolveGlob"

extractglob.name: extractGlob
extractglob.description: This function simply return you the glob part of the glob(s) passed in constructor

extractnoneglob.name: extractNoneGlob
extractnoneglob.description: This function simply return you the none glob part of the glob(s) passed in constructor

@coffeekraken.sugar.js.keyboard.hotkey.name: hotkey
@coffeekraken.sugar.js.keyboard.hotkey.description:
Simple function to add a hotkey like "ctrl+a" and an handler function that will be called when the hotkey has been pressed
The following keys are supported:
- shift, option, alt, ctrl, control, command
- backspace, tab, clear, enter, return, esc, escape, space, up, down, left, right, home, end, pageup, pagedown, del, delete
- from f1 to f19
- all the letters keys

You can pass an option object to your hotkey function call.

@coffeekraken.sugar.node.dependencies.de.name: dependenciesHash
@coffeekraken.sugar.node.dependencies.de.description:
This function take as input an object that follows the structure described in the example bellow.
With that, if will recursively (for files dependencies) load them, check if they have some dependencies,
and create a hash depending on all of that.
Here's the process steps:
1. Check the files dependencies.
2. If their's, load recursively these dependencies and start the process over them again
3. Create a hash for the current dependency with using all non "files" dependencies as well as the file updated timestamp
4. Make this process recursively until all the "files" have been processed
5. Return the final hash for your dependency object

@coffeekraken.sugar.node.fs.pool.name: pool
@coffeekraken.sugar.node.fs.pool.description:
This function simply take as parameter a glob (or array of globs) pattern(s)
and return an SPromise instance through which you can subscribe to events like:
- ready: Emitted once the pool is ready
- file: Emitted for each file founded, added or updated
- files: Emitted with a list of founded files
- change: Emitted when a file has been updated (alias to update)
- update: Emitted when a file has been updated
- unlink: Emitted when a file has been deleted
- add: Emitted when a file has been added

@coffeekraken.sugar.js.cli.buildCommandL.name: buildCommandLine
@coffeekraken.sugar.js.cli.buildCommandL.description:
This function takes as parameters a command line (with tokens), an arguments object and a definition object to
generate the final command line string to launch.
A token is simply a string that begin with "[" and end with "]" like so: "[mytoken]".
Each arguments of the definition object can be a token. If you have an argument called "hostname", the corresponding token will be "[hostname]".
A special token called "[arguments]" is needed if you want the passed arguments to be integrated to the builded command line.

and convert it into the wanted format like "rgba", "hsl", "hsv", "hex", "rgbaString", "hslString" or "hsvString"

example.code:
import convert from '@coffeekraken/sugar/js/color/convert';

@coffeekraken.sugar.js.core.activeSpace.name: activeSpace
@coffeekraken.sugar.js.core.activeSpace.description:
This object expose some functions that are usefull to manage the "active" space of your application.
An active space is represented by a string formated like so "something.cool.hello". This mean that your app is
in the "something.cool.hello" space and depending on that, you can enable or disable some features like for example
keypress that have to be active only in certain "space" of your application.
The exposed functions are these ones:
- set: This allows you to set the active space
- get: This allows you to get the current active space
- is: This allows you to check if the passed active space string is in the current active space
- previous: This allows you to go back 1 activeSpace in the stack
- on: This allows you to register callbacks attached to an activeSpace
- append: This allows you to append an activeSpace string to the current one

get.name: get
get.description: This function allows you to get the current active space

set.name: set
set.description: This function allows you to set the current active space

append.name: append
append.description: This function take the current activeSpace string and add the passed one to set the new activeSpace string

remove.name: remove
remove.description: This function simply remove the passed string from the activeSpace stack

previous.name: previous
previous.description: This function simply go back by 1 in the activeSpace stack

is.name: is
is.description:
This function allows you to check if the active space string that you pass match with the current active space or not.
The checking process is done using the "minimatch" package that let you use cool features like "", "**", etc...

on.name: on
on.description:
This function allows you to register a callback linked with an activeSpace string
that will be called once the activeSpace is matched

This class represent an es6 import statement with properties like:
- path {String}: The import path
- default {String}: The default import name
- star {String}: The start import name "import
as something from ..."
- named {Array<Object>}: THe named imports
- raw {String}: The raw import statement

import SEs6Import from '@coffeekraken/sugar/js/es6/SEs6Import';

star.name: star
star.description:
Store the statement star name like "import
as coco from ..."

named.name: named
named.description:
Store the statement named imports with these properties:
- name {String}: The import name
- as {String}: The import as alias

@coffeekraken.sugar.js.object.deepProxy.name: deepProxy
@coffeekraken.sugar.js.object.deepProxy.description:
This function allows you to add Proxy to an object in deep fashion.
Normally the Proxy process only the level on which it has been added. Here we add Proxy to all the
object levels and to new properties as well.

On the returned proxied object, you will have access to the ```revoke``` method that you can call to revoke the proxy applied.
This method will return you a shallow version of the proxied object that you can use as you want

The uid is hashed into a SHA256 32bits string but you can specify it using the "format" parameter described above

example.code:

uid({ hello: 'world' }, { plop: 'coco' }); // => ijfw89uf98jhw9ef8whef87hw7e8q87wegfh78wgf87gw8fgw8e7fzghwz8efgw8fwzuheihgbweuzf

@coffeekraken.sugar.js.string.sprintf.name: sprintf
@coffeekraken.sugar.js.string.sprintf.description:
Javascript implementation of the sprintf php function.
>For more infos, check [this github repository](https://github.com/alexei/sprintf.js)

example.code:
import sprintf from '@coffeekraken/sugar/js/string/sprintf'
sprintf('Hello %s', 'world') // Hello World

sprintf('Hello %(name)s', user) // Hello Dolly

@coffeekraken.sugar.js.url.parseSchema.name: parseSchema
@coffeekraken.sugar.js.url.parseSchema.description:
This function take two arguments. The first one is the url to parse and the second is a schema to scan the url with.
The schema describe the pathname of an url and tell's how to analyze it.
Here's a little description with some example of schemas:
- "{param1}/{param2}/{param3}": This schema describe that your Url must have 3 "values" named param1, param2 and param3
- If my Url is "something.com/hello/world/plop", my schema is respected and I can have access to the values through the "schema.params.param1", "schema.params.param2", etc...
- "{hello:string}/{world:number}/{?idx:number}": This schema describe that the Url can have 3 "values" but the last one is optional
- If my Url is "something.com/plop/3/1", my schema is respected
- If my Url is "something.com/plop/2", my schema is respected
- If my Url is "something.com/plop/hello/2", my schema is not respected due to the fact that the param named "world" has to be a number

@coffeekraken.sugar.js.value.typeof.name: typeof
@coffeekraken.sugar.js.value.typeof.description:
This function return the correct type of the passed value.
It support the recognition of arrays and return 'Array' as property type.
You can olso ask the function to gives you the "of" types of the passed value. This mean that if you
pass an Array like so "[10,'Hello',true]" and that you ask for "of" types, it will returns you
"Array<Integer|String|Boolean>".
Another feature is to ask the result as an object like so:
{
type: 'Array',
of: ['Integer','String','Boolean']
}
You can ask also the typeof function to returns you the actual class name if the passed value is an instance
of an custom class.

This function simply take a package.json JSON formatted object and standardize
some fields like the "author" one to be sure it is an object at the end,
the "contributors" array the same way as the "author" one, etc... Here's the list
of processed actions:
1. Transform the string version of the "author" field into an object with the properties "name", "email" and "url"
2. Transform the string version of the "contributors" field into an object with the properties "name", "email" and "url"

@coffeekraken.s-vite.node.interface.SVit.name: SViteBuildParamsInterface
@coffeekraken.s-vite.node.interface.SVit.description: This class represent the interface that describe parameters of the SFrontstackViteProcess

input.description: Specify the input js/ts file to use for the build

type.description: Specify the type(s) of build you want. Can be "lib", "bundle" or "module"

format.description: Specify the format(s) of the output build. Can be "es","umd","cjs" or "iife"

target.description: Specify the target you want for your build. Can be "modules","esnext","es2015","es2016" or "es2020"

watch.description: Specify if you want the process to watch for updates and rebuild automatically

lib.description: Specify if your build type is "lib". Same as setting the "type" argument to "lib"

bundle.description: Specify if your build type is "bundle". Same as setting the "type" argument to "bundle"

noWrite.description: Specify if you want to ust build but not write file(s) to the filesystem

prod.description: Specify if your build is made for production environment or not. This will automatically minify and optimize your build

chunks.description: Specify if you allow your build to be separated into multiple chunks or not

minify.description: Specify if you want to minify your build or not

analyze.description: Specify if you want an analyze report of your build. This use the rollup analyze plugin under the hood

@coffeekraken.s-sugar-feature.js.SSugarF.name: SSugarFeature
@coffeekraken.s-sugar-feature.js.SSugarF.description:
This feature allows you to apply some "nice to have" features like having a "scrolled" class applied on the body
when the user has scroll in the page or having access to a `--vh` css variable that represent the exact
viewport innerHeight and avoid having issues with mobile different viewport height values. Note that if you use
the `sPostcssSugarPlugin` postcss plugin, you can use the `vh` unit as normal and if will automatically take the
value of the `--vh` variable if it exists.
More feature can be added in the future depending on the needs.

example.title: Simple usage
example.description: Simply add the `s-sugar` property on your body tag

scrolled.description: Specify if you want the `scrolled` class to be applied on the `body` element when the page has been scrolled

scrolledDelta.description: Specify after how many scroll the scrolled class will be applied

vhvar.description: Specify if you want the `--vh` css variable to be computed and available

resizeTransmations.description: Specify if you want all the transitions and animations cleared during window resize

@coffeekraken.s-sugar-feature.js.interfa.name: SSugarFeatureInterface
@coffeekraken.s-sugar-feature.js.interfa.description: This interface represent the attributes of the SSugarFeature

scrolled.description: Specify if you want the `scrolled` class to be applied on the `body` element when the page has been scrolled

scrolledDelta.description: Specify after how many scroll the scrolled class will be applied

vhvar.description: Specify if you want the `--vh` css variable to be computed and available

resizeTransmations.description: Specify if you want all the transitions and animations cleared during window resize

@coffeekraken.s-side-panel-component.js..description: This class represent the interface that describe parameters of the SSidePanelComponent

@coffeekraken.s-request.shared.interface.name: SRequestParamsInterface
@coffeekraken.s-request.shared.interface.description: This class represent the interface that describe SRequest parameters

baseUrl.description: Specify the base url to call like "https://api.github.com/2.0" for example. If the "url" setting is absolute, this setting will don't have any impact on your request...

method.description: The request method to use like GET, DELETE, HEAD, POST, OPTIONS, PUT or PATCH

headers.description: Specify some headers to add to the request

params.description: Specify some params to be sent through the URL. Must be a plain object or a URLSearchParams object

data.description: Specify some data you want to send with the request. This setting is available only for `PUT`, `POST`, and `PATCH` requests...

timeout.description: Specify time to wait before aborting the actual request. If setted in number format, this will mean milliseconds.

transformRequest.description: Allows changes to the request data before it is sent to the server. See [axios](https://github.com/axios/axios#response-schema) documentation for more.

transformResponse.description: Allows changes to the response data to be made before it is passed to then/catch. See [axios](https://github.com/axios/axios#response-schema) documentation for more.

paramsSerializer.description: An optional function in charge of serializing. See [axios](https://github.com/axios/axios#response-schema) documentation for more.

withCredentials.description: Indicates whether or not cross-site Access-Control requests should be made using credentials. See [axios](https://github.com/axios/axios#response-schema) documentation for more.

auth.description: indicates that HTTP Basic auth should be used, and supplies credentials. See [axios](https://github.com/axios/axios#response-schema) documentation for more.

responseType.description: Indicates encoding to use for decoding responses (Node.js only)

responseEncoding.description: indicates encoding to use for decoding responses (Node.js only). See [axios](https://github.com/axios/axios#response-schema) documentation for more.

xsrfCookieName.description: The name of the cookie to use as a value for xsrf token

xsrfHeaderName.description: The name of the http header that carries the xsrf token value

onUploadProgress.description: Allows handling of progress events for uploads browser only

onDownloadProgress.description: Allows handling of progress events for downloads browser only

maxContentLength.description: Defines the max size of the http response content in bytes allowed in node.js

maxBodyLength.description: (Node only option) defines the max size of the http request content in bytes allowed

validateStatus.description: Defines whether to resolve or reject the promise for a give HTTP response status code. See [axios](https://github.com/axios/axios#response-schema) documentation for more.

maxRedirects.description: Defines the maximum number of redirects to follow in node.js

socketPath.description: Defines a UNIX Socket to be used in node.js. See [axios](https://github.com/axios/axios#response-schema) documentation for more.

httpAgent.description: Define a custom agent to be used when performing http. See [axios](https://github.com/axios/axios#response-schema) documentation for more.

httpsAgent.description: Define a custom agent to be used when performing https. See [axios](https://github.com/axios/axios#response-schema) documentation for more.

proxy.description: Defines the hostname, port, and protocol of the proxy server. See [axios](https://github.com/axios/axios#response-schema) documentation for more.

cancelToken.description: Specifies a cancel token that can be used to cancel the request. See [axios](https://github.com/axios/axios#response-schema) documentation for more.

signal.description: an alternative way to cancel Axios requests using AbortController

decompress.description: indicates whether or not the response body should be decompressed automatically. See [axios](https://github.com/axios/axios#response-schema) documentation for more.

insecureHTTPParser.description: Indicates where to use an insecure HTTP parser that accepts invalid HTTP headers. See [axios](https://github.com/axios/axios#response-schema) documentation for more.

  • World

@coffeekraken.s-range-component.js.Range.name: Range
@coffeekraken.s-range-component.js.Range.description:
This component specify a range with some additional features than the native one like
displaying the value automatically in tooltip or inline.

example.title: External target input
Some colors
example.code:
<s-range name="myRangeColoredSuccess" value="30" class="s-color:success s-mbe:30"></s-range>
<s-range name="myRangeColoredWarning" value="0" class="s-color:warning s-mbe:30"></s-range>
<s-range name="myRangeColoredError" value="1" min="0" max="10" class="s-color:error s-mbe:30"></s-range>

name.description: Specify the name to assign to the internal input[type="range"]

min.description: Specify the minimal value or the range

max.description: Specify the maximal value of the range

step.description: Specify the steps between each values

target.description: Specify a css selector of any HTMLElement or HTMLInputElement in which to inject the value when the range is updated

tooltip.description: Specify if you want to display the value inside a tooltip on top of the thumb

webcomponent.name: webcomponent

props if needed.

@coffeekraken.s-promise.shared.interface.name: SPromiseSettingsInterface
@coffeekraken.s-promise.shared.interface.description: This class represent the interface that describe SPromise settings

treatCancelAs.description: Specify if a "cancel" event/call has to be treated like a "resolve", or like a "reject" a promise level

destroyTimeout.description: Specify after how many milliseconds the promise will be destroyed after a "finally" event

preventRejectOnThrow.description: Specify if you prefer your promise to be "resolved" when an underlying error is catched, or if is has to be rejected normally

emitLogErrorEventOnThrow.description: Specify if you want a "log" of type "error" to be emitted when an underlying error is catched

resolveAtResolveEvent.description: Specify if youw promise has to be resolved when catching a "resolve" event from deeper emitter

rejectAtRejectEvent.description: Specify if youw promise has to be rejected when catching a "reject" event from deeper emitter

resolveProxies.description: Specify some functions to be called just before resolving the promise. This function will take the current promise resolve value and must return the updated value

rejectProxies.description: Specify some functions to be called just before rejecting the promise. This function will take the current promise resolve value and must return the updated value

@coffeekraken.s-log.shared.sLog.name: SLog
@coffeekraken.s-log.shared.sLog.description:
This class represent a log that can be make across the application using the "emit"
function of an SPromise instance for example. It has as goal to centralize and harmonize
what a log can be and can do.
Each log is specified by some characteristic like a "type" that can be something like "SLog.LOG" or "SLog.WARN".
It has also the possibility to unactivate some logs depending on different cisronstances like for example the
fact to set the `SLog.filter([SLog.WARN, SLog.ERROR])` to only let the warn and error logs
activated.

tYPELOG.name: TYPE_LOG
tYPELOG.description: This static constant tells a log that it is of type "LOG"

tYPEINFO.name: TYPE_INFO
tYPEINFO.description: This static constant tells a log that it is of type "INFO"

tYPEWARN.name: TYPE_WARN
tYPEWARN.description: This static constant tells a log that it is of type "WARN"

tYPEERROR.name: TYPE_ERROR
tYPEERROR.description: This static constant tells a log that it is of type "ERROR"

tYPEVERBOSE.name: TYPE_VERBOSE
tYPEVERBOSE.description: This static constant tells a log that it is of type "VERBOSE"

tYPEVERBOSER.name: TYPE_VERBOSER
tYPEVERBOSER.description: This static constant tells a log that it is of type "VERBOSER"

tYPEDECORATOR.name: TYPE_DECORATOR
tYPEDECORATOR.description: This static constant tells a log that it is of type "DECORATOR"

tYPESUMMARY.name: TYPE_SUMMARY
tYPESUMMARY.description: This static constant tells a log that it is of type "SUMMARY"

tYPECHILDPROCESS.name: TYPE_CHILD_PROCESS
tYPECHILDPROCESS.description: This static constant tells a log that it is of type "CHILD_PROCESS"

tYPES.name: TYPES
tYPES.description: This static constant store all the log types available

pRESETSILENT.name: PRESET_SILENT
pRESETSILENT.description: This static constant define a log preset called "silent" that display nothing

pRESETDEFAULT.name: PRESET_DEFAULT
pRESETDEFAULT.description:
This static constant define a log preset called "default" that display:
- LOG
- INFO
- WARN
- ERROR
- DECORATOR
- SUMMARY

pRESETWARN.name: PRESET_WARN
pRESETWARN.description:
This static constant define a log preset called "warn" that display:
- WARN
- ERROR

pRESETERROR.name: PRESET_ERROR
pRESETERROR.description:
This static constant define a log preset called "error" that display:
- ERROR

pRESETVERBOSE.name: PRESET_VERBOSE
pRESETVERBOSE.description:
This static constant define a log preset called "verbose" that display:
- LOG
- INFO
- WARN
- ERROR
- VERBOSE
- DECORATOR
- SUMMARY

pRESETVERBOSER.name: PRESET_VERBOSER
pRESETVERBOSER.description:
This static constant define a log preset called "verboser" that display:
- LOG
- INFO
- WARN
- ERROR
- VERBOSE
- VERBOSER
- DECORATOR
- SUMMARY

pRESETS.name: PRESETS
pRESETS.description: This static constant store all the log presets available

filter.name: filter
filter.description:
This static method allows you to filter the logs across your entire app
at once. To do this, simply name your filter and pass an object describing
what you want to apply as filter.
These filters will have as consequence to set the "active" property of each logs to
true or false.

clearFilters.name: clearFilters
clearFilters.description: This static method allows you to reset all the filters applied

setDefaultLogObj.name: setDefaultLogObj
setDefaultLogObj.description:
This static method allows you to set a default log object
above every others will be extended.

isTypeEnabled.name: isTypeEnabled
isTypeEnabled.description:
This static method allows you Check if a particular log type is enabled or not.
You can pass as well multiple log types as an array.

value.name: value
value.description: Access the "value" property of the SLog object

type.name: type
type.description:
Access the "type" property of the SLog object
This specify which type if the log. LOG, INFO, WARN, ERROR or VERBODE

active.name: active
active.description:
Access the "active" property of the SLog object
This specify if the log is active depending on parameters like `SLog.filter`.
Check the documentation of this static method for more info.

decorators.name: decorators
decorators.description:
Access the "decorators" property of the SLog object.
This specify if the log has to be printed with decorators or not

time.name: time
time.description:
Access the "time" property of the SLog object.
This specify if the log has to be printed with his time or not

timestamp.name: timestamp
timestamp.description: Access the "timestamp" property of the SLog object

clear.name: clear
clear.description:
Access the "clear" property of the SLog object.
This specify if the previous logs have to be cleared before printing this one

margin.name: margin
margin.description: Access the "margin" property of the SLog object.

temp.name: temp
temp.description:
Access the "temp" property of the SLog object.
This specify if this log is a temporary one and if it has to be deleted
when the next log appear.

as.name: as
as.description:
Access the "as" property of the SLog object.
This specify the optimal way the log has to be displayed.
This depends on the logger you use and how it can display logs.

@coffeekraken.s-images-builder.node.SIma.name: SImagesBuilder
@coffeekraken.s-images-builder.node.SIma.description:
This class allows you to compress the more popular images formats like
"png", "jpg", "svg", "gif", etc... using the WONDERFULL sharp library.

glob.description: Specify a glob pattern relative to the "inDir" to target images you want to process

compressExts.description: Specify the file extensions you want to compress

inDir.description: Specify the absolute path to the folder where your images stands

outDir.description: Specify the absolute path to the folder you want to save your images. "inDir" folder structure is kept.

quality.description: Specify the quality percentage you want to target without the "%" sign

webp.description: Specify if you want to generate ".webp" versions of your images or not

@coffeekraken.s-form-validate-feature.js.name: SFormValidateFeature
@coffeekraken.s-form-validate-feature.js.description:
This feature allows you to validate your forms by using under the hood the **AMAZING joi library**.
For now, you can validate data types like `string`, `number` or  `boolean` with options like `email`,
`date`, `greater`, `less`, `min`, `max`, and a lot more.

example.title: Email field
example.code:
<label class="s-label" s-form-validate email>
   Email address
   <input type="text" class="s-input s-width:60" placeholder="olivier.bossel@coffeekraken.io" />
</label>

example.title: Domain field
example.code:
<label class="s-label" s-form-validate domain>
   Domain name
   <input type="text" class="s-input s-width:60" placeholder="coffeekraken.io" />
</label>

example.title: Alphanumeric field
example.code:
<label class="s-label" s-form-validate alphanum>
   Alphanumeric
   <input type="text" class="s-input s-width:60" placeholder="a-zA-Z0-9" />
</label>

example.title: Credit card field
example.code:
<label class="s-label" s-form-validate credit-card>
   Credit card
   <input type="text" class="s-input s-width:60" placeholder="340716737808634" />
</label>

example.title: Min / Max
example.code:
<label class="s-label" s-form-validate min="3" max="6">
   Min and max
   <input type="text" class="s-input s-width:60" placeholder="3 to 6" />
</label>

example.title: Select field
example.code:
<label class="s-label" s-form-validate>
   Select
   <select class="s-select s-width:60">
       <option value="value 1">This is the first option...</option>
       <option value="value 2">This is the second...</option>
       <option value="value 3">Third...</option>
   </select>
</label>

example.title: Select min / max
example.code:
<label class="s-label" s-form-validate min="2" max="2">
   Multiple select
   <select multiple class="s-select s-width:60">
       <option value="value 1">This is the first option...</option>
       <option value="value 2">This is the second...</option>
       <option value="value 3">Third...</option>
   </select>
</label>

example.title: ISO date field
example.code:
<label class="s-label" s-form-validate iso-date>
   ISO date
   <s-date-picker input button name="my-cool-date" placeholder="2021-09-16" class="s-width:60"></s-date-picker>
</label>

example.title: Range min / max
example.code:
<label class="s-label" s-form-validate min="25" max="75">
   Value between 25 and 75
   <s-range class="s-width:60" min="0" max="100" tooltip></s-range>
</label>

example.title: Checkboxes min / max
Custom validation
example.code:
<label class="s-label" s-form-validate coffeekraken>
   Try taping "coffeekraken"
   <input type="text" class="s-input s-width:60" placeholder="coffeekraken" />
</label>

example.title: Submit / Reset

type.description: Specify the validation type. Usually automatically detected depending on the field type

on.description: Specify when to trigger a validation. Can be "change","submit","enter" and/or "reset"

wrap.description: Specify if you want to wrap your s-form-validate element when theres an error

errorClass.description: Specify the class to apply when theres an error

validClass.description: Specify the class to apply on your s-form-validate element when validation is passed successfully

customValidations.description: Specify some custom validations [key]: function(value, helpers). For mor info check out the [Joi](https://joi.dev/api/?v=17.4.2#anycustommethod-description) custom validation doc

joiOptions.description: Specify some [Joi](https://joi.dev/) options to use for your validation

language.description: Specify the language you want to use for messages

displayError.description: Specify if you want to display the error messages or not

alphanum.description: String: Requires the string value to only contain a-z, A-Z, and 0-9.

base64.description: String: Requires the string value to be a valid base64 string; does not check the decoded value.

case.description: String: Sets the required string case

creditCard.description: String: Requires the number to be a credit card number (Using Luhn Algorithm).

dataUri.description: String: Requires the string value to be a valid data URI string.

domain.description: String: Requires the string value to be a valid domain name.

email.description: String: Requires the string value to be a valid email address.

guid.description: String: Requires the string value to be a valid GUID.

hex.description: String: Requires the string value to be a valid hexadecimal string.

hostname.description: String: Requires the string value to be a valid hostname as per RFC1123.

insensitive.description: String: Allows the value to match any value in the allowed list or disallowed list in a case insensitive comparison.

ip.description: String: Requires the string value to be a valid ip address.

isoDate.description: String: Requires the string value to be in valid ISO 8601 date format.

isoDuration.description: String: Requires the string value to be in valid ISO 8601 duration format.

length.description: String: Specifies the exact string length required

lowercase.description: String: Requires the string value to be all lowercase. If the validation convert option is on (enabled by default), the string will be forced to lowercase.

max.description:
String: String: Specifies the maximum number of string characters
Date: Specifies the latest date allowed
Number: Specifies the minimum value

min.description:
String: String: Specifies the minimum number string characters
Date: Specifies the oldest date allowed
Number: Specifies the minimum value

normalize.description: String: Requires the string value to be in a Unicode normalized form. If the validation convert option is on (enabled by default), the string will be normalized.

pattern.description: String: a regular expression object the string value must match against. Note that if the pattern is a regular expression, for it to match the entire key name, it must begin with ^ and end with $.

token.description: String: Requires the string value to only contain a-z, A-Z, 0-9, and underscore _.

trim.description: String: Requires the string value to contain no whitespace before or after. If the validation convert option is on (enabled by default), the string will be trimmed.

truncate.description: String: Specifies whether the string.max() limit should be used as a truncation.

uppercase.description: String: Requires the string value to be all uppercase. If the validation convert option is on (enabled by default), the string will be forced to uppercase.

uri.description: String: Requires the string value to be a valid RFC 3986 URI.

greater.description:
String: Date: Specifies that the value must be greater than date (or a reference)
Number: Specifies that the value must be greater than limit or a reference.

less.description:
String: Date: Specifies that the value must be less than date (or a reference)
Number: Specifies that the value must be less than limit or a reference.

iso.description: Date: Requires the string value to be in valid ISO 8601 date format.

timestamp.description: Date: Requires the value to be a timestamp interval from Unix Time

integer.description: Number: Requires the number to be an integer (no floating point).

multiple.description: Number: Specifies that the value must be a multiple of base (or a reference):

negative.description: Number: Requires the number to be negative

port.description: Number: Requires the number to be a TCP port, so between 0 and 65535.

positive.description: Number: Requires the number to be positive

precision.description: Number: Specifies the maximum number of decimal places

unsafe.description: Number: By default, numbers must be within JavaScript's safety range (Number.MIN_SAFE_INTEGER & Number.MAX_SAFE_INTEGER), and when given a string, should be converted without loss of information. You can allow unsafe numbers at your own risks by calling number.unsafe().

@coffeekraken.s-filtrable-input-componen.name: SFiltrableInputComponentInterface
@coffeekraken.s-filtrable-input-componen.description: This class represent the interface that describe parameters of the SFiltrableInputComponent

items.description: Specify an array of items to use in your filtrable list. Can be a JSON string, a function that take an object with the "value" property and must return an array of items to use

value.description: Specify the attribute in your items to use as a value. Can be also a function that will be called with an object containing the selected item and must return the string you want to use as value

label.description: Specify the attribute in your items to use as a label. Can be also a function that will be called with an object containing the selected item and must return the string you want to use as label

emptyText.description: Specify the text to use for the default "empty" (no result) state

searchValuePreprocess.description: Specify a function used to preprocess the value just before actually searching through the items

loadingText.description: Specify the text to use for the default "loading" state

filterItems.description: Specify a function to use to filter the items. Must return the filtered list of items

filtrable.description: Specify all the properties of your "item" to use as source for the filtrable process

templates.description: Specify either an object with properties like "item", "empty" and "loading", or a function returning the good template depending on tne "type" argument property

closeTimeout.description: Specify the duration before closing the list when having selected an item

interactive.description: Specify if your items in the list are interactive or not to let the user click and interact with them

notSelectable.description: Specify if you want the items to be not selectable

maxItems.description: Specify the maximum number of items to display at first in the list

@coffeekraken.s-filtrable-input-componen.name: Filtrable Input
@coffeekraken.s-filtrable-input-componen.description: These classes allows you to display an input as filtrable

example.code:
${finalParams.styles .map((style) => { return `

${style}style

Click me! Click me! Click me! Click me! Click me! Click me! + Click me!
`; }) .join('\n')}

Scales

Click me! Click me! Click me!

Vertical rhythm and text formatting

Text format mean that all the \`button\` tags inside the \`s-format:text\` class scope will be *styled automatically** using the default style and color.

@coffeekraken.s-filtrable-input-componen.name: filtrableInput
@coffeekraken.s-filtrable-input-componen.description: Apply the filtrable input style to any s-filtrable-input element

@coffeekraken.s-favicon-builder.node.SFa.description: This class allows you to generate all the favicons you need for your website.

input.description: Specify the input image file to use

outDir.description: Specify the output directory ou want your icons in

settings.description: Specify some settings to override and pass to the [favicons](https://www.npmjs.com/package/favicons) builder

@coffeekraken.s-favicon-builder.node.int.name: SFaviconBuilderBuildParamsInterface
@coffeekraken.s-favicon-builder.node.int.description: This class represent the interface that describe parameters of the SFaviconBuilder.build method

input.description: Specify the input image file to use

outDir.description: Specify the output directory ou want your icons in

settings.description: Specify some settings to override and pass to the [favicons](https://www.npmjs.com/package/favicons) builder

@coffeekraken.s-event-emitter.shared.int.name: SEventEmitterPipeSettingsInterface
@coffeekraken.s-event-emitter.shared.int.description: This class represent the interface that describe SEventEmitter.pipe settings

events.description: Specify some events to pipe. Default it pipe everything using `*`

overrideEmitter.description: Specify if the emitter of the event that will be piped has to be overrided by the instance that pipe the event

processor.description: Specify a function that will be called before piping the event value. If you return only 1 value, it will set the value only, otherwise you can return an object with `value` and `metas` property to update also the metas

exclude.description: Specify some event(s) to not pipe at all like `resolve`, `reject`, etc...

filter.description: Specify a function that will receive the value and the metas object and MUST return `true` or `false` to tell if you want to pipe this current event

@coffeekraken.s-event-emitter.shared.int.name: SEventEmitterSettingsInterface
@coffeekraken.s-event-emitter.shared.int.description: This class represent the interface that describe SEventEmitter settings

asyncStart.description: Specify if you want to start the event emitting process by yourself using the `start()` method

bufferTimeout.description: Specify how many ms to wait when the emitter is started to emit the buffered events

defaults.description: Specify some default object values for events. The property define the event name (of minimatch pattern) and the value is the default that will be applied at each emit

castByEvent.description: Specify a class by event name in which the value will be casted automatically. For example, the "log" event value is casted into an SLog instance

bind.description: Specify another object that will be used as the event emitter in the events metas. This do the same as using the `emitter.bind(...)` method

@coffeekraken.s-docmap.node.interface.sD.name: SDocmapBuildParamsInterface
@coffeekraken.s-docmap.node.interface.sD.description:
This class represent the interface that describe the minimum requirement
needed to build the docMap.json file

globs.description: Specify some globs to use to search docblocks to use in docmap generation

exclude.description: Specify some regexp used to exclude files from resulting docMap

tags.description: Specify which docblock tags you want in your final docmap.json file

filters.description: Specify some properties and regex to use to filter docblocks

noExtends.description: Specify if you want to avoid searching for docmap.json files in the dependency packages

save.description: Specify if you want to save the generated file under the ```outPath``` path

outPath.description: Specify where you want to save the builded file. Usually saved in package root with the name docmap.json

@coffeekraken.s-docmap.node.interface.sD.name: SDocmapInstallSnapshotParamsInterface
@coffeekraken.s-docmap.node.interface.sD.description:
This class represent the interface that describe the minimum requirement
needed to install snapshots

glob.description: Specify a glob pattern where to find the snapshots to install

@coffeekraken.s-docmap.node.interface.sD.name: SDocMapReadParamsInterface
@coffeekraken.s-docmap.node.interface.sD.description:
This class represent the interface that describe the minimum requirement
needed to build the docMap.json file

input.description: Specify the input path to the docmap.json file to read

@coffeekraken.s-docmap.node.interface.sD.name: SDocMapSnapshotParamsInterface
@coffeekraken.s-docmap.node.interface.sD.description:
This class represent the interface that describe the minimum requirement
needed to make a docmap snapshot

outDir.description: Specify the directory path where to store your snapshots

@coffeekraken.s-docmap.node.tagsProxy.in.name: interfaceTagProxy
@coffeekraken.s-docmap.node.tagsProxy.in.description:
This field proxy take the "interface" field and transform it to full
interface with props etc...

@coffeekraken.s-docblock.shared.sDockblo.name: SDockblock
@coffeekraken.s-docblock.shared.sDockblo.description:
This is the main class that expose the methods like "parse", etc...
You have to instanciate it by passing a settings object. Here's the available options:

sort.name: sort
sort.description:
This method allows you to set the order in which you want to get the
blocks back when using the methods like get blocks, etc...

parse.name: parse
parse.description:
This method is the principal one. Use it to parse a string
and get back the object version of it

toObject.name: toObject
toObject.description: This method convert the parsed docblocks to a simple object

toString.name: toString
toString.description: This method allows you to get the string version of the docblock(s)

@coffeekraken.s-docblock.shared.sDocbloc.name: SDocblockBlock
@coffeekraken.s-docblock.shared.sDocbloc.description:
This class represent a docblock object that contains all the "tags" values and some features like:
- Converting the block to markdown
- More to come...

tagsMap.name: tagsMap
tagsMap.description: Store the default tags mapping to their parsing functions

registerTag.name: registerTag
registerTag.description:
This static method allows you to register a new tag that will
be recognized by the SDocblockBlock class.

toString.name: toString
toString.description: This method return the passed source string

toObject.name: toObject
toObject.description: This method return the parsed docblock object

@coffeekraken.s-date-picker-component.js.name: Date Picker
@coffeekraken.s-date-picker-component.js.description:
This component specify a date picker. It uses under the hood the **AMAZING pikaday library** with some additional features like
sugar theming support as well as some events and more.
Almost all the pikaday options are available through properties. Check out the api documentation for more details...

example.title: Min and max dates
example.code:
<s-date-picker
         placeholder="Select a date"
         class="s-color:accent s-width--30"
         min-date="2021-08-10"
         max-date="2021-08-20"
         name="myDatePicker2"
         input
     ></s-date-picker>

example.title: Disable weekends
example.code:
<s-date-picker
        placeholder="Select a date"
        class="s-color:complementary s-width--30"
        name="myDatePicker3"
        disable-weekends
        input
    ></s-date-picker>

example.title: RTL
example.code:
<s-date-picker
        placeholder="Select a date"
        class="s-color:accent s-width--30"
        min-date="2021-08-10"
        name="myDatePicker1"
        input
        rtl
    ></s-date-picker>

example.title: With a button
example.code:
<s-date-picker
        placeholder="Select a date"
        class="s-color:accent s-width--30"
        name="myDatePicker4"
        input
        button
    ></s-date-picker>

 @example         html            Disabled
    <s-date-picker
        placeholder="Select a date"
        class="s-color:accent s-width--30"
        name="myDatePicker4"
         disabled
        input
        button
    ></s-date-picker>

example.title: Display more than 1 month
example.code:
<s-date-picker
        placeholder="Select a date"
        class="s-color:accent s-width--30"
        name="myDatePicker4"
        number-of-months="2"
         input
         button
    ></s-date-picker>

example.title: With custom input
example.code:
<s-date-picker name="something" class="s-color:accent">
     <input type="text" name="something" placeholder="Select a date" class="s-width--30" />
 </s-date-picker>

example.title: With a custom button
example.code:
<s-date-picker
        placeholder="Select a date"
        class="s-color:error"
        name="myDatePicker5"
    >
      <button class="s-btn">Select a date</button>
    </s-date-picker>

example.title: With a custom input and button
example.code:
<s-date-picker
        placeholder="Select a date"
        class="s-color:error"
        name="myDatePicker5"
    >
      <input type="text" name="something" placeholder="Select a date" class="s-width--30" />
      <button class="s-btn">Select a date</button>
    </s-date-picker>

name.descrition: Specify the name for your input name

placeholder.description: Specify a placeholder for your input

format.description: Specify the format to use for your datepicker

firstDay.description: Specify the first day of the week. 0 is sunday, 1 monday, etc...

minDate.description: the minimum/earliest date that can be selected (this should be a native Date object - e.g. new Date() or moment().toDate())

maxDate.description: the maximum/latest date that can be selected (this should be a native Date object - e.g. new Date() or moment().toDate())

disableWeekends.description: disallow selection of Saturdays or Sundays

disabled.description: Specify if your date picker is disabled

yearRange.description: number of years either side (e.g. 10) or array of upper/lower range (e.g. [1900,2015])

rtl.description: reverse the calendar for right-to-left languages

i18n.description: language defaults for month and weekday names

events.description: array of dates that you would like to differentiate from regular days (e.g. ['Sat Jun 28 2017', 'Sun Jun 29 2017', 'Tue Jul 01 2017',])

input.description: Specify if you want a visible input injected if you don't have specified yours.

button.description: Specify if you want a button attached to your input or not

arrowIcon.description: Specify the svg code for the arrow used across the datepicker

calendarIcon.description: Specify the svg code for the calendar icon used in the button

webcomponent.name: webcomponent
webcomponent.description:
This function allows you to define (register) your webcomponent with some default
props if needed.

@coffeekraken.s-component-utils.js.inter.name: SComponentUtilsDefaultPropsInterface
@coffeekraken.s-component-utils.js.inter.description: This class represent the interface that describe parameters of a basic SComponent

@coffeekraken.s-component-utils.js.inter.name: SComponentUtilsSettingsInterface
@coffeekraken.s-component-utils.js.inter.description: This class represent the interface that describe SComponentUtils settings

interface.description: Specify an SInterface class to use as our properties definition

style.description: Specify a style string to use as style to inject for our component

defaultProps.description: Pass an object that act as the default properties value for our component

@coffeekraken.s-color-picker-component.j.name: Color Picker
@coffeekraken.s-color-picker-component.j.description:
This component specify a color picker. It uses under the hood the **AMAZING Pickr library** with some additional features like
sugar theming support as well as some events and more.
Almost all the Pickr options are available through properties. Check out the api documentation for more details...

example.title: With an input and a button
example.code: <s-color-picker value="#5101FF" placeholder="Select a color" input button></s-color-picker>

example.title: With a custom input and button
example.code:
<s-color-picker>
     <input type="text" placeholder="Select a color" value="#FABB03" />
     <button class="s-btn s-color:error">Select a color</button>
</s-color-picker>

example.title: RTL
example.code: <s-color-picker value="#FABB03" placeholder="Select a color" input button dir="rtl"></s-color-picker>

name.description: Specify the name that will be assigned to the injected input if you don't provide one yourself

value.description: Specify the initial value for your picker

placeholder.description: Specify the placeholder that will be assigned to the injected input if you don't provide one yourself

theme.description: Specify the theme you want to use for this picker

input.description: Specify if you dont want an automatically injected text input when you dont provide yours

button.description: Specify if you want to display the button or not

position.description: Specify the position of the picker. Can be "top" or "bottom"

swatches.description: Specify some colors you want in your swatches

disabled.description: Specify if the color picker is disabled

@coffeekraken.s-code-example-component.j.name: SCodeExampleComponentInterface
@coffeekraken.s-code-example-component.j.description: This class represent the interface that describe parameters of the SCodeExampleComponent

active.description: Specify which "tab" is active in case of multiple languages examples

toolbar.description: Specify what you want in the toolbar. Currently available item is "copy"

toolbarPosition.description: Specify the toolbar position. Can be "content" or "nav"

languages.description: Specify some languages that you want to support. Must be "[key]: language" object syntax. See [highlight.js doc](https://github.com/highlightjs/highlight.js/blob/main/SUPPORTED_LANGUAGES.md) for supported languages

lines.description: Specify how many lines to display at max

more.description: Specify if you want to expand the more feature at start or not

@coffeekraken.s-code-example-component.j.name: Code Example
@coffeekraken.s-code-example-component.j.description: This component represent a code example that make sure your passed code(s) is displayed well using under the hood the AMAZING [highlightjs](https://highlightjs.org/) library.

example.code:
<s-code-example>
     <template lang="js">
function $initHighlight(block, cls) {
try {
  if (cls.search(/\bno\-highlight\b/) != -1)
    return process(block, true, 0x0F) +
           ` class="${cls}"`;
} catch (e) {
}
for (var i = 0 / 2; i < classes.length; i++) {
  if (checkCondition(classes[i]) === undefined)
    console.log('undefined');
}
     </template>
</s-code-example>

active.description: Specify which "tab" is active in case of multiple languages examples

toolbar.description: Specify what you want in the toolbar. Currently available item is "copy"

toolbarPosition.description: Specify the toolbar position. Can be "content" or "nav"

languages.description: Specify some languages that you want to support. Must be "[key]: language" object syntax. See [highlight.js doc](https://github.com/highlightjs/highlight.js/blob/main/SUPPORTED_LANGUAGES.md) for supported languages

lines.description: Specify how many lines to display at max

more.description: Specify if you want to expand the more feature at start or not

@coffeekraken.s-clipboard-copy-component.name: SClipboardCopyComponentInterface
@coffeekraken.s-clipboard-copy-component.description: This class represent the interface that describe parameters of the SClipboardCopyComponent

successTimeout.description: Specify the duration for displaying the "success" icon

errorTimeout.description: Specify the duration for displaying the "error" icon

@coffeekraken.s-activate-feature.js.SAct.name: SActivateFeature
@coffeekraken.s-activate-feature.js.SAct.description:
This feature allows you to activate some elements depending on triggers like `click`, `mouseover`, `mouseout`, `anchor`, etc...
To be explicit, you can apply this feature on a link tag with the href attribute `#something`, and on click,
the DOM element that has the id "something" will get the "active" class applied.

example.title: Simple click activation
example.code:
Click me!
I will be activated on click

example.title: Grouping
example.code:
Tab 1 Tab 1 Tab 1
Content #1
Content #2
Content #3

example.title: Toggle mode
example.code:
Click me!
I will be toggled on click

href.description: Specify the target element(s) to activate/unactivate

group.description: Specify a group id for your element. This is used for things like tabs, etc...

toggle.description: Specify if you want to be able to click on the same element to activate/unactivate it.

history.description: Specify if you want to store and react to history hash changes

active.description: Specify the initial state of your element

activeClass.description: Specify the class applied on target(s) when active. Default is "active"

activeAttribute.description: Specify the attribute name applied on target(s) when active.

saveState.description: Specify if you want to save state in localStorage to restore it on page reload, etc...

activateTimeout.description: Specify a timeout before actiavting the target(s)

unactivateTimeout.description: Specify a timeout before unactivate the target(s)

triggerer.description: Specify an element selector that will be used as the triggerer instead of this current element

trigger.description: Specify what trigger an activate/unactivate action. Can be "click", "mouseover", "mouseout" and/or "anchor"

unactivateOn.description: Specify some event(s) catched on the body tag that will unactivate the target(s)

isactive.name: isActive
isactive.description: This method allows you to know if this particular s-activate node is active or not

activate.name: activate
activate.description: This async method allows you to activate this particular s-activate node

unactivate.name: unactivate
unactivate.description: This async method allows you to unactivate this particular s-activate node

active.description: Specify the initial state of your element

activeAttribute.description: Specify the attribute name applied on target(s) when active.

saveState.description: Specify if you want to save state in localStorage to restore it on page reload, etc...

activateTimeout.description: Specify a timeout before actiavting the target(s)

unactivateTimeout.description: Specify a timeout before unactivate the target(s)

triggerer.description: Specify an element selector that will be used as the triggerer instead of this current element

trigger.description: Specify what trigger an activate/unactivate action. Can be "click", "mouseover", "mouseout" and/or "anchor"

unactivateOn.description: Specify some event(s) catched on the body tag that will unactivate the target(s)

@coffeekraken.coffeekraken-io.js.dom.que.name: querySelectorLive
@coffeekraken.coffeekraken-io.js.dom.que.description:
Observe the dom to get all the elements that matches a passed css selector at any point in time.
Be warned that this use the mutation observer API and will monitor all the document for new nodes. Make sure to use it
when you don't have the chance to use the custom elements API instead

@coffeekraken.coffeekraken-io.sugar.css..name: Global reset
@coffeekraken.coffeekraken-io.sugar.css..description:
These mixins allows you to apply some resets like `destyle` and/or the `sugar` one.
The `destyle` one is well known and you can find the documentation on their website.
The `sugar` one is our own that add some resets like setting max-width to 100% for images, and some more. Check our his own documentation page.

  </label>
  <label class="s-mbe:30 s-label">
    I'm disabled
    <input type="checkbox" disabled class="s-checkbox s-color:accent" name="checkbox-style-solid-3" value="hello 3" />
  </label>

@coffeekraken.coffeekraken-io.sugar.css..name: Fit Sizes
@coffeekraken.coffeekraken-io.sugar.css..description:
These classes allows you to apply a fit size on any HTMLElement.
On image and video, uses `object-fit` property, on all others,
simply fill the element using an absolute position, top: 0, left: 0 and width/height: 100%.

@coffeekraken.coffeekraken-io.sugar.css..name: Format text
@coffeekraken.coffeekraken-io.sugar.css..description:
This class allows you to apply some formatting to pure HTMLElement that are scoped into.
For example, a simple `ul` tag will be styled as if the `s-list:ul` class would be applied on it
when it is scoped inside the `s-format:text` class.
This feature has to be implemented using the `@sugar.format.text` mixin on the elements you
want to support the text formatting.

example.code:
Text format

Maiores aut adipisci voluptatum ex aspernatur sit.

  • Joy Rosenbaum
  • Leah DuBuque
  • Warren Goyette

@coffeekraken.coffeekraken-io.sugar.css..name: Rhythm vertical
@coffeekraken.coffeekraken-io.sugar.css..description:
This class allows you to apply some margins to make space between direct childs.
This feature has to be implemented using the `@sugar.rhythm.vertical` mixin on the elements you
want to support the rhythm vertical.

(underline) Santiago Nienow

(uppercase) Clay Howell
(capitalize) Ms. Mable Jones

@coffeekraken.coffeekraken-io.sugar.css..name: Offsize
@coffeekraken.coffeekraken-io.sugar.css..description:
These classes allows you to apply an offsize to any HTMLElement.
An offsize is a "space" that you want to ADD to the width/height of an element.
You can specify where you want to add this offsize like for margin and padding by using the "inline" and "block" notation.

@coffeekraken.coffeekraken-io.sugar.css..name: Scale
@coffeekraken.coffeekraken-io.sugar.css..description:
These classes allows to apply a scale to any supported UI elements.
This scale does not use the transform property but increase actual values like `padding`,
`margin`, etc... In fact, all the properties setted with the `sugar.scallable` function.
It's usually a good practice to set the `font-size` of your UI element to `sugar.scalable(1rem)`
and then to set inner values using `em` unit.

@coffeekraken.coffeekraken-io.sugar.css..name: s-scale:10
@coffeekraken.coffeekraken-io.sugar.css..description:
This class allows you to apply a "<yellow>10</yellow>" scale style to any HTMLElement.
Note that this scale is not applied using the "transform" property but it will scale
all the properties that uses the function "sugar.scalable" to set his value.

@coffeekraken.coffeekraken-io.sugar.css..name: Icons
@coffeekraken.coffeekraken-io.sugar.css..description:
These classes represent all the icons that you have listed in your project using the `@sugar.icon.classes` mixin.
By using this mixin, your icons will be accessible using the same `s-icon:{name}` classes
independently of the icon source that can be *Fontawesome** or your **Filesystem**.
These providers are the one that we support for now but others can be added if needed.

global reset.name: Global reset
global reset.description:
These mixins allows you to apply some resets like `destyle` and/or the `sugar` one.
The `destyle` one is well known and you can find the documentation on their website.
The `sugar` one is our own that add some resets like setting max-width to 100% for images, and some more. Check our his own documentation page.

destyle reset.name: Destyle reset
destyle reset.description: These mixins allows you to apply the `destyle` reset easily.

sugar reset.name: Sugar reset
sugar reset.description: This mixin allows you to apply the `sugar` reset easily.

s-blockquote.name: s-blockquote
s-blockquote.description: This class represent a default blockquote

example.code:
<input type="checkbox" class="s-checkbox" value="something" name="mycheckboxItem1" />
<input type="checkbox" class="s-checkbox" value="something" name="mycheckboxItem2" />
<input type="checkbox" class="s-checkbox" value="something" name="mycheckboxItem3" />

s-dropdown.name: s-dropdown
s-dropdown.description: This class represent a(n) "<yellow>bottom (center)</yellow>" aligned dropdown

s-fs-tree.name: s-fs-tree
s-fs-tree.description: This class represent an "<yellow>default</yellow>" filesystem tree

example.code:
• Molly Nader
    • Kathleen Toy
    • Darryl Parisian
    • Jake Hyatt
  • Dorothy Predovic
  • Byron Lind DVM

s-list--icon.name: s-list--icon
s-list--icon.description: This class represent an "<yellow>ul</yellow>" list with some "<cyan>icon</cyan>" instead of the default bullet

s-rhythm:vertical.name: s-rhythm:vertical
s-rhythm:vertical.description: This class represent some lists in the s-rhythm:vertical scope

example.code:
• Hello world
  • Hello world
  • Hello world
  1. Hello world
  2. Hello world
  3. Hello world

<input type="radio" class="s-radio" value="something" name="myRadioItem1" />
<input type="radio" class="s-radio" value="something" name="myRadioItem2" />
<input type="radio" class="s-radio" value="something" name="myRadioItem3" />

<label class="s-label">
  <input type="checkbox" class="s-switch
pill" />

</label>

package.name: @coffeekraken/sugar
package.description: A little sugar in your codebase

package.name: @coffeekraken/s-vite
package.description: ViteJS without the headaches

docmap.name: SSugarFeature
docmap.description:
This feature allows you to apply some "nice to have" features like having a "scrolled" class applied on the body
when the user has scroll in the page or having access to a `--vh` css variable that represent the exact
viewport innerHeight and avoid having issues with mobile different viewport height values. Note that if you use
the `sPostcssSugarPlugin` postcss plugin, you can use the `vh` unit as normal and if will automatically take the
value of the `--vh` variable if it exists.
More feature can be added in the future depending on the needs.

example.title: Simple usage
example.description: Simply add the `s-sugar` property on your body tag

scrolled.description: Specify if you want the `scrolled` class to be applied on the `body` element when the page has been scrolled

scrolledDelta.description: Specify after how many scroll the scrolled class will be applied

vhvar.description: Specify if you want the `--vh` css variable to be computed and available

resizeTransmations.description: Specify if you want all the transitions and animations cleared during window resize

docmap.name: SRefocusFeature
docmap.description: This feature allows you to automatically visually refocus an element that is inside a scrollable one on different trigger(s) like events, etc...

example.title: Simple usage
example.code:
• Hello
  • World

trigger.description: Specify some trigger(s) on which to refocus a particular element like `event:actual`, `anchor`, `history`, etc...

scrollToSettings.description: Specify some `scrollTo` settings to override the default ones

timeout.description: Specify a timeout to wait before refocus the element

docmap.name: Range
docmap.description:
This component specify a range with some additional features than the native one like
displaying the value automatically in tooltip or inline.

example.title: External target input
Some colors
example.code:
<s-range name="myRangeColoredSuccess" value="30" class="s-color:success s-mbe:30"></s-range>
<s-range name="myRangeColoredWarning" value="0" class="s-color:warning s-mbe:30"></s-range>
<s-range name="myRangeColoredError" value="1" min="0" max="10" class="s-color:error s-mbe:30"></s-range>

name.description: Specify the name to assign to the internal input[type="range"]

min.description: Specify the minimal value or the range

max.description: Specify the maximal value of the range

step.description: Specify the steps between each values

target.description: Specify a css selector of any HTMLElement or HTMLInputElement in which to inject the value when the range is updated

tooltip.description: Specify if you want to display the value inside a tooltip on top of the thumb

webcomponent.name: webcomponent
webcomponent.description:
This function allows you to define (register) your webcomponent with some default
props if needed.

docmap.name: SParallaxFeature
docmap.description: This feature allows you to easily apply some parallax effect to any HTMLElement items you want.

example.code:
I will move on mousemove
I will move on mousemove
I will move on mousemove

amount.description: Specify the amount of parallax you want to apply

amountX.description: Specify the amount of parallax you want for the x axis. This will be applied on top of the global amount

amountY.description: Specify the amount of parallax you want for the y axis. This will be applied on top of the global amount

amountTranslateX.description: Specify the amount of parallax you want for the translate x axis. This will be applied on top of the global amount

amountTranslateY.description: Specify the amount of parallax you want for the translate y axis. This will be applied on top of the global amount

amountRotateX.description: Specify the amount of parallax you want for the rotate x axis. This will be applied on top of the global amount

amountRotateY.description: Specify the amount of parallax you want for the rotate y axis. This will be applied on top of the global amount

docmap.name: SFormValidateFeature
docmap.description:
This feature allows you to validate your forms by using under the hood the **AMAZING joi library**.
For now, you can validate data types like `string`, `number` or  `boolean` with options like `email`,
`date`, `greater`, `less`, `min`, `max`, and a lot more.

example.title: Email field
example.code:
<label class="s-label" s-form-validate email>
   Email address
   <input type="text" class="s-input s-width:60" placeholder="olivier.bossel@coffeekraken.io" />
</label>

example.title: Domain field
example.code:
<label class="s-label" s-form-validate domain>
   Domain name
   <input type="text" class="s-input s-width:60" placeholder="coffeekraken.io" />
</label>

example.title: Alphanumeric field
example.code:
<label class="s-label" s-form-validate alphanum>
   Alphanumeric
   <input type="text" class="s-input s-width:60" placeholder="a-zA-Z0-9" />
</label>

example.title: Credit card field
example.code:
<label class="s-label" s-form-validate credit-card>
   Credit card
   <input type="text" class="s-input s-width:60" placeholder="340716737808634" />
</label>

example.title: Min / Max
example.code:
<label class="s-label" s-form-validate min="3" max="6">
   Min and max
   <input type="text" class="s-input s-width:60" placeholder="3 to 6" />
</label>

example.title: Select field
example.code:
<label class="s-label" s-form-validate>
   Select
   <select class="s-select s-width:60">
       <option value="value 1">This is the first option...</option>
       <option value="value 2">This is the second...</option>
       <option value="value 3">Third...</option>
   </select>
</label>

example.title: Select min / max
example.code:
<label class="s-label" s-form-validate min="2" max="2">
   Multiple select
   <select multiple class="s-select s-width:60">
       <option value="value 1">This is the first option...</option>
       <option value="value 2">This is the second...</option>
       <option value="value 3">Third...</option>
   </select>
</label>

example.title: ISO date field
example.code:
<label class="s-label" s-form-validate iso-date>
   ISO date
   <s-date-picker input button name="my-cool-date" placeholder="2021-09-16" class="s-width:60"></s-date-picker>
</label>

example.title: Range min / max
example.code:
<label class="s-label" s-form-validate min="25" max="75">
   Value between 25 and 75
   <s-range class="s-width:60" min="0" max="100" tooltip></s-range>
</label>

example.title: Checkboxes min / max
Custom validation
example.code:
<label class="s-label" s-form-validate coffeekraken>
   Try taping "coffeekraken"
   <input type="text" class="s-input s-width:60" placeholder="coffeekraken" />
</label>

example.title: Submit / Reset

type.description: Specify the validation type. Usually automatically detected depending on the field type

on.description: Specify when to trigger a validation. Can be "change","submit","enter" and/or "reset"

wrap.description: Specify if you want to wrap your s-form-validate element when theres an error

errorClass.description: Specify the class to apply when theres an error

validClass.description: Specify the class to apply on your s-form-validate element when validation is passed successfully

customValidations.description: Specify some custom validations [key]: function(value, helpers). For mor info check out the [Joi](https://joi.dev/api/?v=17.4.2#anycustommethod-description) custom validation doc

joiOptions.description: Specify some [Joi](https://joi.dev/) options to use for your validation

language.description: Specify the language you want to use for messages

displayError.description: Specify if you want to display the error messages or not

alphanum.description: String: Requires the string value to only contain a-z, A-Z, and 0-9.

base64.description: String: Requires the string value to be a valid base64 string; does not check the decoded value.

case.description: String: Sets the required string case

creditCard.description: String: Requires the number to be a credit card number (Using Luhn Algorithm).

dataUri.description: String: Requires the string value to be a valid data URI string.

domain.description: String: Requires the string value to be a valid domain name.

email.description: String: Requires the string value to be a valid email address.

guid.description: String: Requires the string value to be a valid GUID.

hex.description: String: Requires the string value to be a valid hexadecimal string.

hostname.description: String: Requires the string value to be a valid hostname as per RFC1123.

insensitive.description: String: Allows the value to match any value in the allowed list or disallowed list in a case insensitive comparison.

ip.description: String: Requires the string value to be a valid ip address.

isoDate.description: String: Requires the string value to be in valid ISO 8601 date format.

isoDuration.description: String: Requires the string value to be in valid ISO 8601 duration format.

length.description: String: Specifies the exact string length required

lowercase.description: String: Requires the string value to be all lowercase. If the validation convert option is on (enabled by default), the string will be forced to lowercase.

max.description:
String: String: Specifies the maximum number of string characters
Date: Specifies the latest date allowed
Number: Specifies the minimum value

min.description:
String: String: Specifies the minimum number string characters
Date: Specifies the oldest date allowed
Number: Specifies the minimum value

normalize.description: String: Requires the string value to be in a Unicode normalized form. If the validation convert option is on (enabled by default), the string will be normalized.

pattern.description: String: a regular expression object the string value must match against. Note that if the pattern is a regular expression, for it to match the entire key name, it must begin with ^ and end with $.

token.description: String: Requires the string value to only contain a-z, A-Z, 0-9, and underscore _.

trim.description: String: Requires the string value to contain no whitespace before or after. If the validation convert option is on (enabled by default), the string will be trimmed.

truncate.description: String: Specifies whether the string.max() limit should be used as a truncation.

uppercase.description: String: Requires the string value to be all uppercase. If the validation convert option is on (enabled by default), the string will be forced to uppercase.

uri.description: String: Requires the string value to be a valid RFC 3986 URI.

greater.description:
String: Date: Specifies that the value must be greater than date (or a reference)
Number: Specifies that the value must be greater than limit or a reference.

less.description:
String: Date: Specifies that the value must be less than date (or a reference)
Number: Specifies that the value must be less than limit or a reference.

iso.description: Date: Requires the string value to be in valid ISO 8601 date format.

timestamp.description: Date: Requires the value to be a timestamp interval from Unix Time

integer.description: Number: Requires the number to be an integer (no floating point).

multiple.description: Number: Specifies that the value must be a multiple of base (or a reference):

negative.description: Number: Requires the number to be negative

port.description: Number: Requires the number to be a TCP port, so between 0 and 65535.

positive.description: Number: Requires the number to be positive

precision.description: Number: Specifies the maximum number of decimal places

unsafe.description: Number: By default, numbers must be within JavaScript's safety range (Number.MIN_SAFE_INTEGER & Number.MAX_SAFE_INTEGER), and when given a string, should be converted without loss of information. You can allow unsafe numbers at your own risks by calling number.unsafe().

docmap.description: These classes allows you to display an input as filtrable

`; }) .join('\n')}

Scales
